result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose M. Ortez-Herrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No contact with C.R.L. or residence.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

SAFE program, intake and follow through with recommendations, or treatment of the like in State of Colorado; 

domestic violence treatment to be completed within 60 days unless otherwise approved by agent.  

AODA and follow through with any recommendations.  

60/90/120 day probation review hearings.   

DNA sample. 

Court has no objection to serving jail and probation in county of residence in the State of Colorado if they will accept terms of jail and probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
MCJ with Huber or EMP for work, if eligible. Court has no objection to serving jail and probation in county of residence in State of Colorado if they will accept terms of jail and probation. 45 days to report to jail.
Concurrent with: each other and count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose M. Ortez-Herrera

records.addlTxt: Processed Financial Request Form
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Called:  11;23 a.m. 
Clerk: Amy. 
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon for ADA Natalie Zibolski.  
Defendant appears in person with Atty Amaro Lopez. 
Spanish interpreter, Teresa Berger appears in person, sworn and interprets.  

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DRI Count 1 (1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety/Domestic Abuse); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 
Count 2 (Strangulation and Suffocation/Attempt/DA)>>NO CONTEST.  
Count 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA)>>NO CONTEST.  
Count 4 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on Count 2: SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program, intake and follow through with recommendations, or treatment of the like in State of Colorado; domestic violence treatment to be completed within 60 days unless otherwise approved by agent.  AODA and follow through with any recommendations.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No contact with C.R.L. or residence.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings.   90 days jail I/S for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharges.  

COURT ORDERS on Count 3 and Count 4:  9 months MCJ with huber or EMP for work, if eligible; concurrent with each other and Count 2.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharges.  COURT grants 25 days credit.  

COURT has no objection to serving jail and probation in county of residence in State of Colorado if they will accept terms of jail and probation.  COURT grants 45 days to report to jail.   

Adj:  11:54 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing notice; not deliverable as addressed by USPS
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 11:10 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:44 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry for ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Amaro Lopez.  
Spanish interpreter, Sally Nichols appears by video. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW. 
Defense has asked to reset matter; State is in agreement for extending. 
Atty Lopez states there is an agreement however deft has relocated to Colorado and requesting jail me transferred to county of residence. 
COURT has no objection.  

COURT resets plea/sentencing hearing for 7/13/22 at 11:10 a.m. (20 mins)

Adj:  3:48 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2022 at 03:40 pm.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:13 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Amaro Lopez.  
Spanish interpreter, Laura Salcido appears by video. 

Date and time set for JPTC; VRCW.  
Atty Lopez advises there was an offer received from State; discovery received this week and needs to complete review, requesting plea/sentencing. 
State has no objection. 

COURT sets plea/sentencing for 5/11/22 at 3:40 p.m. 

Adj:  3:17 p.m.

$25,000 signature bond with first $5,000 in cash.  No contact with victim(s): C.R.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. Police escort to retreive personal property from the residence.
